version_description:
***Now available for iPad! Search “Launch Center Pro” on the iPad App Store.***

New in 2.2
- Dropbox Text: launch://dropbox/new?text=
- Text-to-Speech: launch://speak?text=
- Dictionary Lookup: launch://define?text=
- VoiceOver support
- Move actions between groups
- Additional enhancements and bug fixes

Visit help.contrast.co for more detailed release notes.
- Bug fixes

Based on feedback from 2.3 we made some big changes to the way input tags are processed. Manually creating complex actions should be much easier now. Visit help.contrast.co for more detailed released notes.

New in 2.3.1
- Prompt Default Text: [prompt=My Default Text]
- Prompt List Delimiters: [prompt-list(, )]
- Giphy Bookmarks
- Fixed various Launch Center Connect/IFTTT issues
- Additional Enhancements and Bug Fixes

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review. If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co

- Fixes an issue causing Quick Actions to disappear
- Resolves an issue causing options to be hidden behind the keyboard
- Resolves an issue with contact selection
- Fixes issues with TextExpander support
- Resolves issues with Launch Center Connect and IFTTT
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review, it really helps! If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co or visit http://help.contrast.co for help.

- Fixes an issue causing actions to disappear
- Fixes an issue causing icons in the Today widget to disappear
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review, it really helps! If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co or visit http://help.contrast.co for help.

- Updated for iOS 10
- Added support for dictation in text prompts
- Updated widget for iOS 10 including the new Quick Action Widget
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements

Due to the shutdown of Parse.com, Launch Center Pro no longer supports direct integration with IFTTT. We apologize for the inconvenience. All data and user accounts will be permanently deleted by Parse as it shuts down the service.

IFTTT now has an iOS app that does much of what was supported in Launch Center Pro. If you need to create more complex workflows with IFTTT, give the Workflow app a try.

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review, it really helps! If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co or visit http://help.contrast.co for help.

- Fixed Dropbox API issues
- Support for iOS 11
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review, it really helps! If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co or visit http://help.contrast.co for help.

- Support for iPhone X
- Fixed a bug preventing location and iBeacon triggers from working
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review, it really helps! If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co or visit http://help.contrast.co for help.

- Widget icons can now be resized!
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review, it really helps! If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co or visit http://help.contrast.co for help.

- Fixed editing of Quick Actions on iPad and iPhone 11 on iOS 13
- Changed default Quick Action icon to a bullet as it was before this summer's update
- Added back support for * and # in tel: URLs
- Updated to support iOS 13 style editing and other improvements
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review, it really helps! If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co or visit http://help.contrast.co for help.

We've reworked a lot of the app and fixed several lingering bugs in preparation for the big 3.0 update we've been working on. We wanted to get this update out now to make sure all the changes we made deep in the code don't cause bugs that would spoil the launch of Launch Center Pro 3.0.

- Added the ability to seamlessly switch languages while dictating (any languages set up as system keyboards will be available for dictation)
- Accessing photos now displays a progress spinner
- When creating an icon from a photo, the photo now centers properly
- Improved handling of timezones and daylight savings for scheduled actions
- Improved iPhone X support (GIF selection, message/mail compose views, etc. are no longer cropped)
- Fixed day of the week selection for location triggers
- Removed Twitter/Facebook/Weibo actions since iOS no longer supports those services natively
- Added https to welcome view to finalize App Transport Security support
- Dictation language is now set to the the system keyboard language. If keyboards in multiple languages are active, there's an option to seamlessly switch back and forth.
- Fixed bugs related to case sensitivity and prepend/append in Dropbox actions
- In Location Triggers setting a time no longer causes the contents of that row to overflow into the space below
- Fixed help view UI on iPhone X
- Fixed issue that was causing results to scroll over the search bar when searching for actions in the Action Composer
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review, it really helps! If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co or visit http://help.contrast.co for help.

- Widget icons can now be resized!
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review, it really helps! If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co or visit http://help.contrast.co for help.

Launch Center Pro 3.0 is a huge update and lays the foundation for the future of the app. In addition to the features listed below, we’ve made significant performance improvements (kind of important for a launcher app!) and modernized much of the code to provide a solid foundation for all the cool stuff we have in the works.

New in 3.0:
- NFC Triggers: iPhone XR, XS, and XS Max can now trigger actions via custom NFC stickers! iPhone 7 and newer can use in-app NFC scanning.
- Themes: We created a brand new “True Black” theme that looks gorgeous on OLED iPhones (and also looks nice on LCD iPhones)
- Advanced scheduling: You can now assign multiple schedules to a single action
- Add to Siri: Turn actions into Siri Shortcuts and trigger them with your voice
- Alternate App Icons: choose from several color variations and all past Launch Center Pro app icons
- Icon import from the Shortcuts app
- Support for iPhone XR, XS, and XS Max screen sizes
- Launch Center Pro for iPad has been retired, the iPhone version now supports both iPhone and iPad
- Bug fixes and additional enhancements

With 3.0 we’re also making Launch Center Pro free to use, with a subscription or one-time purchase to unlock all features. If you’ve paid for Launch Center Pro in the past, you get to keep using all the features you paid for without a subscription. You also get several new features and all the bug fixes, speed improvements, and other enhancements we’ve been working on for months. You only need to pay if you want to access the new features added in 3.0. That said, we have lots planned for the app, and would certainly appreciate your support to achieve those goals. We went out of our way to make this transition as fair as possible for users who have previously paid.

New in 3.0:
- NFC Triggers: iPhone XR, XS, and XS Max can now trigger actions via custom NFC stickers! iPhone 7 and newer can use in-app NFC scanning.
- Themes: We created a brand new “True Black” theme that looks gorgeous on OLED iPhones (and also looks nice on LCD iPhones)
- Advanced scheduling: You can now assign multiple schedules to a single action
- Add to Siri: Turn actions into Siri Shortcuts and trigger them with your voice
- Alternate App Icons: choose from several color variations and all past Launch Center Pro app icons
- Icon import from the Shortcuts app
- Support for iPhone XR, XS, and XS Max screen sizes
- Launch Center Pro for iPad has been retired, the iPhone version now supports both iPhone and iPad
- Bug fixes and additional enhancements

With 3.0 we’re also making Launch Center Pro free to use, with a subscription or one-time purchase to unlock all features. If you’ve paid for Launch Center Pro in the past, you get to keep using all the features you paid for without a subscription. You also get several new features and all the bug fixes, speed improvements, and other enhancements we’ve been working on for months. You only need to pay if you want to access the new features added in 3.0. That said, we have lots planned for the app, and would certainly appreciate your support to achieve those goals. We went out of our way to make this transition as fair as possible for users who have previously paid.

***So sorry for the hassle, this version fixes the bug causing purchases to not properly unlock features, as well as a couple of other minor bugs.***

Launch Center Pro 3.0 is a huge update and lays the foundation for the future of the app. In addition to the features listed below, we’ve made significant performance improvements (kind of important for a launcher app!) and modernized much of the code to provide a solid foundation for all the cool stuff we have in the works.

New in 3.0:
• NFC Triggers: iPhone XR, XS, and XS Max can now trigger actions via custom NFC stickers! iPhone 7 and newer can use in-app NFC scanning.
• Themes: We created a brand new “True Black” theme that looks gorgeous on OLED iPhones (and also looks nice on LCD iPhones)
• Advanced scheduling: You can now assign multiple schedules to a single action
• Add to Siri: Turn actions into Siri Shortcuts and trigger them with your voice
• Alternate App Icons: choose from several color variations and all past Launch Center Pro app icons
• Icon import from the Shortcuts app
• Support for iPhone XR, XS, and XS Max screen sizes
• Launch Center Pro for iPad has been retired, the iPhone version now supports both iPhone and iPad
• Bug fixes and additional enhancements

With 3.0 we’re also making Launch Center Pro free to use, with a subscription or one-time purchase to unlock all features. If you’ve paid for Launch Center Pro in the past, you get to keep using all the features you paid for without a subscription. You also get several new features and all the bug fixes, speed improvements, and other enhancements we’ve been working on for months. You only need to pay if you want to access the new features added in 3.0. That said, we have lots planned for the app, and would certainly appreciate your support to achieve those goals. We went out of our way to make this transition as fair as possible for users who have previously paid.

Features:
- Schedule actions via URL schemes (examples below)
- Add to Siri is now available to all users for free
- Redesigned subscription page to make purchase options more clear
- iPhone 7, 8, and X can now scan NFC tags using launch://nfc

Bug fixes:
- Location Triggers view now scrolls properly on iPhone X when setting the time for "Suppress duplicates"
- Reduced (hopefully eliminated) the number of times the App Store login is displayed
- Tapping the Notification Sounds row on iPad now opens the correct view (instead of opening the NFC Triggers view, which should not be available on iPad)
- Actions imported from Shortcuts now function as expected (some imported actions couldn't be triggered from the widget in 3.0.2)
- Messaging actions now remove extra commas to prevent "Buddy Name" from being displayed as a recipient
- Widget settings are now backed up
- Fixed several crashing bugs

Scheduling Examples:
launch://schedule?action=179&in=1h&repeat=specificdays&days=m,tu,w,th,f (Schedules an action notification in 1 hour, tapping the notification triggers action 179, then repeats this schedule on weekdays)

launch://schedule?action=104&in=[prompt-num:Minutes Until Notification]m (Prompts for the number of minutes, then schedules an action notification in 10 minutes, tapping the notification triggers action 104)

launch://schedule?url=https://apple.com&in=10min (Schedules an action notification in 10 minutes, tapping the notification opens apple.com)

Parameters:
action = Action Id
url = Any valid URL
at = Absolute ISO8601 date (plus it should detect a bunch of common formats)
in = Relative date in seconds, minutes, or hours from now (60s, 60m, 1h, or even 1h30m30s)
repeat = hourly or weekly or monthly or specificdays (aliases 'specific-days', 'days')
days = (only used for repeat=specificdays) accepts the actual days to repeat the schedule, pretty flexible, "su,m,tuesday-wed,th,f,sat" works as expected.

And of course, you can use Shortcuts to build these URLs based on time calculated from a Shortcut. On help.contrast.co we have several example Shortcuts, including one that gets the next event on your calendar, estimates your ETA, then schedules an action to trigger when you're estimated to arrive (you could also schedule it a few minutes early so that the notification is ready and waiting when you arrive), and finally displays directions to that event in Maps.

Visit help.contrast.co for more examples and detailed docs.

Features:
- Added a “title” parameter to scheduling URLs (example: launch://schedule?action=179&in=10m&title={{Break time is over!}}

Bug fixes:
- Fixed a bug causing groups to load slowly

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review, it really helps! If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co or visit http://helpc.ontrast.co for help.

Bug fixes:
- Fixed schedule title not appearing in notifications
- Fixed Dialer View layout

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review, it really helps! If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co or visit http://helpc.ontrast.co for help.

Bug fixes:
- Fixed a bug that was causing actions to be locked for users who had previously paid for the app
- Fixing that bug also fixed the bug causing frequent App Store password prompts

It should not have taken us this long to find and fix this bug, so sorry for the delay. This should fix it once and for all, but if something like this pops up again we’ll drop everything and get it fixed. We’ve been hard at work on an exciting new update that should be released soon.

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review, it really helps! If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co or visit http://helpc.ontrast.co for help.

The Icon Composer is all new in Launch Center Pro 3.1! We've added new shapes, new icon styles, more colors, thousands of new glyphs, size and style options for glyphs, and customizable icon badges. You can also save these icons to your photo library to use with the Add to Home Screen feature in Shortcuts.

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review, it really helps! If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co or visit http://help.contrast.co for help.

The Icon Composer is all new in Launch Center Pro 3.1! We've added new shapes, new icon styles, more colors, thousands of new glyphs, size and style options for glyphs, and customizable icon badges. You can also save these icons to your photo library to use with the Add to Home Screen feature in Shortcuts.

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review, it really helps! If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co or visit http://help.contrast.co for help.

- Improved performance of the Icon Composer (there are still performance issues on beta versions of iOS, but we’ll get those fixed in time for the public release of new versions of iOS this fall)
- Fixed an issue that was causing groups to automatically close if you tapped on them right after launching the app
- Restored the default Quick Action glyph to “•” instead of “(?)”
- Two rows of icons should now be displayed in the widget instead of just one when two rows should fit
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review, it really helps! If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co or visit http://help.contrast.co for help.

- Fixed editing of Quick Actions on iPad and iPhone 11 on iOS 13
- Changed default Quick Action icon to a bullet as it was before this summer's update
- Added back support for * and # in tel: URLs
- Updated to support iOS 13 style editing and other improvements
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements

If you like Launch Center Pro, please take a moment to leave a review, it really helps! If not, please send your feedback to launch@contrast.co or visit http://help.contrast.co for help.

- Added new duotone glyphs to the Icon Composer
- Added new icon styles to the Icon Composer (iOS 12 and iOS 13 Shortcuts style backgrounds)
- Fixed issues with legacy glyphs in the Icon Composer
- Fixed restoration of manual backups
- Fixed a bug causing the app to crash on launch for some users
- Theme selection no long resets to the white theme randomly
- Additional bug fixes and enhancements
